  • •

    finally, the Q-function for the expert π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is LQsubscript𝐿𝑄L_{Q}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-smooth

    |Qπ⋆⁢(s,c,a)−Qπ⋆⁢(s′,c′,a′)|≤LQ⋅d⁢((s,c,a),(s′,c′,a′)).superscript𝑄superscript𝜋⋆𝑠𝑐𝑎superscript𝑄superscript𝜋⋆superscript𝑠′superscript𝑐′superscript𝑎′⋅subscript𝐿𝑄𝑑𝑠𝑐𝑎superscript𝑠′superscript𝑐′superscript𝑎′|Q^{\pi^{\star}}(s,c,a)-Q^{\pi^{\star}}(s^{\prime},c^{\prime},a^{\prime})|\leq L% _{Q}\cdot d((s,c,a),(s^{\prime},c^{\prime},a^{\prime})).| italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) - italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | ≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ italic_d ( ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) , ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) .

We note that smoothness of the noisy expert is guaranteed by construction if the expert π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is Lπsubscript𝐿𝜋L_{\pi}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-smooth.

Assumption 3.

(Smooth MI) For every pair of sequences of trajectories {τ1:n−1,τ1:n−1′}⊆(𝒮×𝒜)H⁢(n−1)subscript𝜏:1𝑛1subscriptsuperscript𝜏′:1𝑛1superscript𝒮𝒜𝐻𝑛1\{\tau_{1:n-1},\tau^{\prime}_{1:n-1}\}\subseteq(\mathcal{S\times A})^{H(n-1)}{ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ⊆ ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_A ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_n - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, (s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞(s,c)\in\mathcal{S\times C}( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C, c1:n−1∈𝒞n−1subscript𝑐:1𝑛1superscript𝒞𝑛1c_{1:n-1}\in\mathcal{C}^{n-1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, τ~∈(𝒮×𝒜)H~𝜏superscript𝒮𝒜𝐻\tilde{\tau}\in(\mathcal{S\times A})^{H}over~ start_ARG italic_τ end_ARG ∈ ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_A ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and cn∈𝒞subscript𝑐𝑛𝒞c_{n}\in\mathcal{C}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C, we assume that the mutual information at step n𝑛nitalic_n is LIsubscript𝐿𝐼L_{I}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-smooth with respect to the mean square deviation of collected trajectories:

|ℐ(𝝅(s,c);𝝅~(τ~,cn)|c1:n−1,τ1:n−1)−ℐ(𝝅(s,c);𝝅~(τ~,cn)|c1:n−1,τ1:n−1′)|≤LI⋅d(τ1:n−1,τ1:n−1′),|\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s,c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tilde{\tau},c_{n})|c_{1:n-1},\tau% _{1:n-1})-\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s,c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tilde{\tau},c_{n})|c_{1:% n-1},\tau^{\prime}_{1:n-1})|\leq L_{I}\cdot d(\tau_{1:n-1},\tau^{\prime}_{1:n-% 1}),| caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( over~ start_ARG italic_τ end_ARG , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( over~ start_ARG italic_τ end_ARG , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | ≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ italic_d ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where d((s0,1,a0,1,…sH,n−1,aH,n−1),(s0,1′,a0,1′,…sH,n−1′,aH,n−1′)=1n−1∑m=1n−1(∑t=0H−1d((s_{0,1},a_{0,1},\dots s_{H,n-1},a_{H,n-1}),(s^{\prime}_{0,1},a^{\prime}_{0,% 1},\dots s^{\prime}_{H,n-1},a^{\prime}_{H,n-1})=\frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{m=1}^{n-1}(% \sum_{t=0}^{H-1}italic_d ( ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H , italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H , italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H , italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H , italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n - 1 end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥st,m−st,m′∥22+∥at,m−at,m′∥22)12\|s_{t,m}-s^{\prime}_{t,m}\|_{2}^{2}+\|a_{t,m}-a^{\prime}_{t,m}\|_{2}^{2})^{% \frac{1}{2}}∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the mean square deviation over the concatenation of trajectories.

A.2 Proof

We first prove that, under Assumptions 2 and 3, the effect of stochasticity on the mutual information at step n𝑛nitalic_n is bounded.

Lemma 1.

Let Assumptions 2 and 3 hold. Fix a sequence of tasks c1:n−1subscript𝑐:1𝑛1c_{1:n-1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and consider two arbitrary sequences of trajectories τ1:n−1subscript𝜏:1𝑛1\tau_{1:n-1}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and τ1:n−1′subscriptsuperscript𝜏′:1𝑛1\tau^{\prime}_{1:n-1}italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sampled from 𝛕⁢(c1:n−1)𝛕subscript𝑐:1𝑛1\bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Fix one state-task pair (s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞(s,c)\in\mathcal{S\times C}( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C, one task cn∈𝒞subscript𝑐𝑛𝒞c_{n}\in\mathcal{C}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C and one trajectory τ~∼𝛕⁢(cn)similar-to~𝜏𝛕subscript𝑐𝑛\tilde{\tau}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{n})over~ start_ARG italic_τ end_ARG ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Let ϵn=8⁢H32⁢(1+max⁡(LP,Lπ))H⁢max⁡(ϵ0,ϵπ,ϵP)subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛8superscript𝐻32superscript1subscript𝐿𝑃subscript𝐿𝜋𝐻subscriptitalic-ϵ0subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\epsilon_{n}=8H^{\frac{3}{2}}(1+\max(L_{P},L_{\pi}))^{H}\max(\epsilon_{0},% \epsilon_{\pi},\epsilon_{P})italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 8 italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 3 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + roman_max ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). The difference in mutual information when conditioning on the two sequences of trajectories can be bounded:

|ℐ(𝝅(s,c);𝝅~(τ~,cn)|τi:n−1)−ℐ(𝝅(s,c);𝝅~(τ~,cn)|τi:n−1′)|≤ϵn.|\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s,c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tilde{\tau},c_{n})|\tau_{i:n-1})-% \mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s,c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tilde{\tau},c_{n})|\tau^{\prime}_{% i:n-1})|\leq\epsilon_{n}.| caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( over~ start_ARG italic_τ end_ARG , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( over~ start_ARG italic_τ end_ARG , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | ≤ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .
Proof.

Under Assumption 3 it is sufficient to show that stochasticity in the MDP does not cause the demonstrator’s trajectories to deviate excessively. This is a direct consequence of smoothness and boundedness, which we assume in Assumption 2, and can be shown by induction. Let us fix a task cn∈𝒞subscript𝑐𝑛𝒞c_{n}\in\mathcal{C}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C and consider two trajectories τ,τ′∼𝝉⁢(cn)similar-to𝜏superscript𝜏′𝝉subscript𝑐𝑛\tau,\tau^{\prime}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{n})italic_τ , italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). For the two initial states (s0,s0′)subscript𝑠0subscriptsuperscript𝑠′0(s_{0},s^{\prime}_{0})( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), boundedness of the initial state distribution μ0subscript𝜇0\mu_{0}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT implies that ‖s0−s0′‖2≤ϵμ0subscriptnormsubscript𝑠0subscriptsuperscript𝑠′02subscriptitalic-ϵsubscript𝜇0\|s_{0}-s^{\prime}_{0}\|_{2}\leq\epsilon_{\mu_{0}}∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Now, assuming that the distance between two states (st,st′)subscript𝑠𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑡(s_{t},s^{\prime}_{t})( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is bounded as ‖st−st′‖2≤ϵtsubscriptnormsubscript𝑠𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑡2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡\|s_{t}-s^{\prime}_{t}\|_{2}\leq\epsilon_{t}∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have that

ϵt+1subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡1\displaystyle\epsilon_{t+1}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT :=‖st+1−st+1′‖2assignabsentsubscriptnormsubscript𝑠𝑡1subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑡12\displaystyle:=\|s_{t+1}-s^{\prime}_{t+1}\|_{2}:= ∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (7)
≤(i)𝒲(P(⋅|st,at),P(⋅|st′,at′))+2ϵP\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(i)}}{{\leq}}\mathcal{W}(P(\cdot|s_{t},a_{% t}),P(\cdot|s^{\prime}_{t},a^{\prime}_{t}))+2\epsilon_{P}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP caligraphic_W ( italic_P ( ⋅ | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_P ( ⋅ | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (8)
≤LP⋅(‖st−st′‖2+‖at−at′‖2)+2⁢ϵPabsent⋅subscript𝐿𝑃subscriptnormsubscript𝑠𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑡2subscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑎′𝑡22subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle\leq L_{P}\cdot(\|s_{t}-s^{\prime}_{t}\|_{2}+\|a_{t}-a^{\prime}_{% t}\|_{2})+2\epsilon_{P}≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( ∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (9)
=LP⋅(ϵt+‖at−at′‖2)+2⁢ϵPabsent⋅subscript𝐿𝑃subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡subscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑎′𝑡22subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle=L_{P}\cdot(\epsilon_{t}+\|a_{t}-a^{\prime}_{t}\|_{2})+2\epsilon_% {P}= italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (10)
≤(i⁢i)LP⋅(ϵt+𝒲(𝝅~(⋅|st,ct),𝝅~(⋅|st′,ct′))+2ϵπ)+2ϵP\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(ii)}}{{\leq}}L_{P}\cdot(\epsilon_{t}+% \mathcal{W}(\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\cdot|s_{t},c_{t}),\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\cdot|s^{% \prime}_{t},c^{\prime}_{t}))+2\epsilon_{\pi})+2\epsilon_{P}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + caligraphic_W ( overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( ⋅ | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( ⋅ | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (11)
≤Lπ⋅(ϵt+Lπ⋅‖st−st′‖2+2⁢ϵπ)+2⁢ϵPabsent⋅subscript𝐿𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡⋅subscript𝐿𝜋subscriptnormsubscript𝑠𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑡22subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle\leq L_{\pi}\cdot(\epsilon_{t}+L_{\pi}\cdot\|s_{t}-s^{\prime}_{t}% \|_{2}+2\epsilon_{\pi})+2\epsilon_{P}≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (12)
=LP⋅(ϵt+Lπ⋅ϵt+2⁢ϵπ)+2⁢ϵPabsent⋅subscript𝐿𝑃subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡⋅subscript𝐿𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle=L_{P}\cdot(\epsilon_{t}+L_{\pi}\cdot\epsilon_{t}+2\epsilon_{\pi}% )+2\epsilon_{P}= italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (13)
=LP⋅((Lπ+1)⋅ϵt+2⁢ϵπ)+2⁢ϵPabsent⋅subscript𝐿𝑃⋅subscript𝐿𝜋1subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle=L_{P}\cdot((L_{\pi}+1)\cdot\epsilon_{t}+2\epsilon_{\pi})+2% \epsilon_{P}= italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 ) ⋅ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (14)
=LP⁢(1+Lπ)⁢ϵt+2⁢(LP⁢ϵπ+ϵP)absentsubscript𝐿𝑃1subscript𝐿𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡2subscript𝐿𝑃subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle=L_{P}(1+L_{\pi})\epsilon_{t}+2(L_{P}\epsilon_{\pi}+\epsilon_{P})= italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (15)
:=A⁢ϵt+B,assignabsent𝐴subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡𝐵\displaystyle:=A\epsilon_{t}+B,:= italic_A italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_B , (16)

where Lemma 9 was used in (i) and (ii); Assumption 2 and the fact that ct=ct′subscript𝑐𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑐′𝑡c_{t}=c^{\prime}_{t}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT were used through the rest of the derivation. The recurrence relation can be easily unrolled as

ϵtsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡\displaystyle\epsilon_{t}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤At⁢ϵ0+∑i=0t−1Ai⁢Babsentsuperscript𝐴𝑡subscriptitalic-ϵ0superscriptsubscript𝑖0𝑡1superscript𝐴𝑖𝐵\displaystyle\leq A^{t}\epsilon_{0}+\sum_{i=0}^{t-1}A^{i}B≤ italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B (17)
≤At⁢ϵ0+max⁡(At−1,1)⁢B⁢tabsentsuperscript𝐴𝑡subscriptitalic-ϵ0superscript𝐴𝑡11𝐵𝑡\displaystyle\leq A^{t}\epsilon_{0}+\max(A^{t-1},1)Bt≤ italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_max ( italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 1 ) italic_B italic_t (18)
≤max(A,1)t(ϵ0+Bt)\displaystyle\leq\max(A,1)^{t}(\epsilon_{0}+Bt)≤ roman_max ( italic_A , 1 ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_B italic_t ) (19)
=max(LP(1+Lπ),1)t(ϵ0+2t(LPϵπ+ϵP))\displaystyle=\max(L_{P}(1+L_{\pi}),1)^{t}(\epsilon_{0}+2t(L_{P}\epsilon_{\pi}% +\epsilon_{P}))= roman_max ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , 1 ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_t ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (20)
≤(1+LP)t⁢(1+Lπ)t⁢(ϵ0+2⁢t⁢((1+LP)⁢ϵπ+ϵP))absentsuperscript1subscript𝐿𝑃𝑡superscript1subscript𝐿𝜋𝑡subscriptitalic-ϵ02𝑡1subscript𝐿𝑃subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle\leq(1+L_{P})^{t}(1+L_{\pi})^{t}(\epsilon_{0}+2t((1+L_{P})% \epsilon_{\pi}+\epsilon_{P}))≤ ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_t ( ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (21)
≤(1+LP)t⁢(1+Lπ)t⁢(2⁢t⁢(1+LP)⁢max⁡(ϵ0,ϵπ,ϵP))absentsuperscript1subscript𝐿𝑃𝑡superscript1subscript𝐿𝜋𝑡2𝑡1subscript𝐿𝑃subscriptitalic-ϵ0subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\displaystyle\leq(1+L_{P})^{t}(1+L_{\pi})^{t}(2t(1+L_{P})\max(\epsilon_{0},% \epsilon_{\pi},\epsilon_{P}))≤ ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 italic_t ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_max ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (22)

thus bounding the L2 distances between states at each step of the trajectory ϵt=‖st−st′‖2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡subscriptnormsubscript𝑠𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑡2\epsilon_{t}=\|s_{t}-s^{\prime}_{t}\|_{2}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∥ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We note that the distance between actions can also be easily bound by Lemma 9: ‖at−at′‖2≤Lπ⁢ϵt+2⁢ϵπsubscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑎′𝑡2subscript𝐿𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑡2subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋\|a_{t}-a^{\prime}_{t}\|_{2}\leq L_{\pi}\epsilon_{t}+2\epsilon_{\pi}∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This can in turn be related to distances over trajectories. Let us fix c1:n−1∈𝒞subscript𝑐:1𝑛1𝒞c_{1:n-1}\in\mathcal{C}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C and consider τ1:n−1,τ1:n−1′∼𝝉⁢(c1:n−1)similar-tosubscript𝜏:1𝑛1subscriptsuperscript𝜏′:1𝑛1𝝉subscript𝑐:1𝑛1\tau_{1:n-1},\tau^{\prime}_{1:n-1}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). We have that

(35)

Having obtained an upper bound on the distance between sequences of trajectories, the result follows naturally from smoothness of mutual information according to Assumption 3.

∎

We can now focus on the main result. We start by introducing an important measure, quantifying the maximum information gain at each round:

Γn:=maxc′∈𝒞⁡ψn⁢(c′)=maxc′∈𝒞⁢𝔼τ1:n−1∼𝝉⁢(c1:n−1)τ′∼𝝉⁢(c′)c∼μc,(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(st,c);𝝅~⁢(τ′,c′)∣c1:n−1,τ1:n−1)assignsubscriptΓ𝑛subscriptsuperscript𝑐′𝒞subscript𝜓𝑛superscript𝑐′subscriptsuperscript𝑐′𝒞subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝜏:1𝑛1𝝉subscript𝑐:1𝑛1similar-tosuperscript𝜏′𝝉superscript𝑐′formulae-sequencesimilar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1ℐ𝝅subscript𝑠𝑡𝑐conditionalbold-~𝝅superscript𝜏′superscript𝑐′subscript𝑐:1𝑛1subscript𝜏:1𝑛1\Gamma_{n}:=\max_{c^{\prime}\in\mathcal{C}}\psi_{n}(c^{\prime})=\max_{c^{% \prime}\in\mathcal{C}}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}\tau_{1:n-1}\sim% \bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})\\ \tau^{\prime}\sim\bm{\tau}(c^{\prime})\\ c\sim\mu_{c},\;(s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}% \mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s_{t},c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tau^{\prime},c^{\prime})\mid c% _{1:n-1},\tau_{1:n-1})roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (36)

We note that the criterion in Equation 6 takes the arg⁢maxargmax\operatorname*{arg\,max}roman_arg roman_max of the same quantity ΓnsubscriptΓ𝑛\Gamma_{n}roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT maximizes over. As common in the literature (Bogunovic et al., 2016; Kothawade et al., 2020; Hübotter et al., 2024), we make a standard assumption on diminishing informativeness.

Assumption 4.

For each n,i∈ℕ𝑛𝑖ℕn,i\in\mathbb{N}italic_n , italic_i ∈ blackboard_N with i≤n𝑖𝑛i\leq nitalic_i ≤ italic_n, the maximum information gain at round n𝑛nitalic_n is not greater than the maximum information gain at round i𝑖iitalic_i:

Γn≤Γi.subscriptΓ𝑛subscriptΓ𝑖\Gamma_{n}\leq\Gamma_{i}.roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

This can be leveraged to show that the expected mutual information is sublinear in the number of rounds n𝑛nitalic_n. From this point, we overload the notation and allow policies (e.g. 𝝅𝝅\bm{\pi}bold_italic_π) to map vector to random vectors, that is 𝝅⁢((x0,…,xn−1))=(𝝅⁢(x0),…,𝝅⁢(xn−1))𝝅subscript𝑥0…subscript𝑥𝑛1𝝅subscript𝑥0…𝝅subscript𝑥𝑛1\bm{\pi}((x_{0},\dots,x_{n-1}))=(\bm{\pi}(x_{0}),\dots,\bm{\pi}(x_{n-1}))bold_italic_π ( ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = ( bold_italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , … , bold_italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) for (x0,…,xn−1)∈(𝒮×𝒞)nsubscript𝑥0…subscript𝑥𝑛1superscript𝒮𝒞𝑛(x_{0},\dots,x_{n-1})\in(\mathcal{S\times C})^{n}( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∈ ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Lemma 2.

Under Assumptions 1 and 4, if (c0,…,cn)subscript𝑐0…subscript𝑐𝑛(c_{0},\dots,c_{n})( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) follows the criterion in Equation 6, then Γn≤Hn⁢γ(H⁢n)subscriptΓ𝑛𝐻𝑛subscript𝛾𝐻𝑛\Gamma_{n}\leq\frac{H}{n}\gamma_{(Hn)}roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where γ(H⁢n)=maxX⊆𝒮×𝒞|X|≤H⁢n⁡ℐ⁢(𝛑⁢(𝒮×𝒞);𝛑~⁢(X))subscript𝛾𝐻𝑛subscript𝑋𝒮𝒞𝑋𝐻𝑛ℐ𝛑𝒮𝒞bold-~𝛑𝑋\gamma_{(Hn)}=\max_{\begin{subarray}{c}X\subseteq\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{C}% \\ |X|\leq Hn\end{subarray}}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(\mathcal{S\times C});\bm{\tilde{% \pi}}(X))italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_X ⊆ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_X | ≤ italic_H italic_n end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_X ) ).

Proof.
ΓnsubscriptΓ𝑛\displaystyle\Gamma_{n}roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =1n⁢∑i=0n−1Γnabsent1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖0𝑛1subscriptΓ𝑛\displaystyle=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}\Gamma_{n}= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (37)
≤(i)1n⁢∑i=0n−1Γisuperscript𝑖absent1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖0𝑛1subscriptΓ𝑖\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(i)}}{{\leq}}\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}% \Gamma_{i}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (38)
=1n⁢∑i=0n−1maxc′∈𝒞⁢𝔼τ1:n−1∼𝝉⁢(c1:n−1)τ′∼𝝉⁢(c′)c∼μc,(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s0,c);𝝅~⁢(τ′,c′)∣c1:n−1,τ1:n−1)absent1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖0𝑛1subscriptsuperscript𝑐′𝒞subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝜏:1𝑛1𝝉subscript𝑐:1𝑛1similar-tosuperscript𝜏′𝝉superscript𝑐′formulae-sequencesimilar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1ℐ𝝅subscript𝑠0𝑐conditionalbold-~𝝅superscript𝜏′superscript𝑐′subscript𝑐:1𝑛1subscript𝜏:1𝑛1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}\max_{c^{\prime}\in\mathcal{C}}% \mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}\tau_{1:n-1}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})\\ \tau^{\prime}\sim\bm{\tau}(c^{\prime})\\ c\sim\mu_{c},\;(s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}% \mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s_{0},c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tau^{\prime},c^{\prime})\mid c% _{1:n-1},\tau_{1:n-1})= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (39)
=(i⁢i)1n⁢∑i=0n−1𝔼τ1:n−1∼𝝉⁢(c1:n−1)τ′∼𝝉⁢(cn)c∼μc,(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s0,c);𝝅~⁢(τ′,cn)∣c1:n−1,τ1:n−1)superscript𝑖𝑖absent1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖0𝑛1subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝜏:1𝑛1𝝉subscript𝑐:1𝑛1similar-tosuperscript𝜏′𝝉subscript𝑐𝑛formulae-sequencesimilar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1ℐ𝝅subscript𝑠0𝑐conditionalbold-~𝝅superscript𝜏′subscript𝑐𝑛subscript𝑐:1𝑛1subscript𝜏:1𝑛1\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(ii)}}{{=}}\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}% \mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}\tau_{1:n-1}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})\\ \tau^{\prime}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{n})\\ c\sim\mu_{c},\;(s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}% \mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s_{0},c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tau^{\prime},c_{n})\mid c_{1:n% -1},\tau_{1:n-1})start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c ) ; =1n⁢𝔼c∼μc(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1𝔼τn∼𝝉⁢(cn)τ1:n−1∼𝝉⁢(c1:n−1)∑i=0n−1ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s0,c);𝝅~⁢(τn,cn)∣c1:n−1,τ1:n−1)absent1𝑛subscript𝔼similar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝜏𝑛𝝉subscript𝑐𝑛similar-tosubscript𝜏:1𝑛1𝝉subscript𝑐:1𝑛1superscriptsubscript𝑖0𝑛1ℐ𝝅subscript𝑠0𝑐conditionalbold-~𝝅subscript𝜏𝑛subscript𝑐𝑛subscript𝑐:1𝑛1subscript𝜏:1𝑛1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{n}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}c\sim\mu_{c}% \\ (s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}\mathop{\mathbb{E}% }_{\begin{subarray}{c}\tau_{n}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{n})\\ \tau_{1:n-1}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})\end{subarray}}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}\mathcal{I}% (\bm{\pi}(s_{0},c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tau_{n},c_{n})\mid c_{1:n-1},\tau_{1:n-1})= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (41)
=(i⁢i⁢i)1n⁢𝔼c∼μc(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1𝔼τn∼𝝉⁢(cn)τ1:n−1∼𝝉⁢(c1:n−1)ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s0,c);𝝅~⁢(τ1:n,c1:n))superscript𝑖𝑖𝑖absent1𝑛subscript𝔼similar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝜏𝑛𝝉subscript𝑐𝑛similar-tosubscript𝜏:1𝑛1𝝉subscript𝑐:1𝑛1ℐ𝝅subscript𝑠0𝑐bold-~𝝅subscript𝜏:1𝑛subscript𝑐:1𝑛\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(iii)}}{{=}}\frac{1}{n}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}% _{\begin{subarray}{c}c\sim\mu_{c}\\ (s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}\mathop{\mathbb{E}% }_{\begin{subarray}{c}\tau_{n}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{n})\\ \tau_{1:n-1}\sim\bm{\tau}(c_{1:n-1})\end{subarray}}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s_{0},% c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(\tau_{1:n},c_{1:n}))start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_i italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (42)
≤1n⁢𝔼c∼μc(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1maxX⊆𝒮×𝒞|X|=H⁢n⁡ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s0,c);𝝅~⁢(X))absent1𝑛subscript𝔼similar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1subscript𝑋𝒮𝒞𝑋𝐻𝑛ℐ𝝅subscript𝑠0𝑐bold-~𝝅𝑋\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{n}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}c\sim\mu_{% c}\\ (s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}\max_{\begin{% subarray}{c}X\subseteq\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{C}\\ |X|=Hn\end{subarray}}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s_{0},c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(X))≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_X ⊆ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_X | = italic_H italic_n end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_X ) ) (43)
≤1n⁢𝔼c∼μc(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)∑t=0H−1maxX⊆𝒮×𝒞|X|=H⁢n⁡ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(𝒮×𝒞);𝝅~⁢(X))absent1𝑛subscript𝔼similar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐superscriptsubscript𝑡0𝐻1subscript𝑋𝒮𝒞𝑋𝐻𝑛ℐ𝝅𝒮𝒞bold-~𝝅𝑋\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{n}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}c\sim\mu_{% c}\\ (s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\sum_{t=0}^{H-1}\max_{\begin{% subarray}{c}X\subseteq\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{C}\\ |X|=Hn\end{subarray}}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(\mathcal{S\times C});\bm{\tilde{\pi}% }(X))≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_X ⊆ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_X | = italic_H italic_n end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_X ) ) (44)
=Hn⁢maxX⊆𝒮×𝒞|X|=H⁢n⁡ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(𝒮×𝒞);𝝅~⁢(X))absent𝐻𝑛subscript𝑋𝒮𝒞𝑋𝐻𝑛ℐ𝝅𝒮𝒞bold-~𝝅𝑋\displaystyle=\frac{H}{n}\max_{\begin{subarray}{c}X\subseteq\mathcal{S}\times% \mathcal{C}\\ |X|=Hn\end{subarray}}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(\mathcal{S\times C});\bm{\tilde{\pi}% }(X))= divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_X ⊆ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_X | = italic_H italic_n end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_X ) ) (45)
=Hn⁢γ(H⁢n)absent𝐻𝑛subscript𝛾𝐻𝑛\displaystyle=\frac{H}{n}\gamma_{(Hn)}= divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (46)

where (i) follows from Assumption 4, (ii) follows from Equation 6, (iii) is due to the chain rule of mutual information. We note that γn=maxX⊆𝒮×𝒞,|X|≤n⁡ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(𝒮×𝒞);𝝅~⁢(X))subscript𝛾𝑛subscriptformulae-sequence𝑋𝒮𝒞𝑋𝑛ℐ𝝅𝒮𝒞bold-~𝝅𝑋\gamma_{n}=\max_{X\subseteq\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{C},\;|X|\leq n}\mathcal{I% }(\bm{\pi}(\mathcal{S\times C});\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(X))italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X ⊆ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C , | italic_X | ≤ italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_X ) ) is sublinear for a large class of GPs. In this cases, a looser upper bound would be H2⁢γnnsuperscript𝐻2subscript𝛾𝑛𝑛H^{2}\frac{\gamma_{n}}{n}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG. ∎

This bound on expected round-wise mutual information can then be leveraged to describe how the total variance shrinks over rounds.

Lemma 3.

(Uniform convergence of marginal variance, following Hübotter et al. (2024)) Under Assumption 1, 2 and 3, for any n≥0𝑛0n\geq 0italic_n ≥ 0 and (s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞(s,c)\in\mathcal{S\times C}( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C,

σn2⁢(s,c)≤(1+ϵn)⁢2⁢σ¯2⁢Γnτmin2,superscriptsubscript𝜎𝑛2𝑠𝑐1subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛2superscript¯𝜎2subscriptΓ𝑛superscriptsubscript𝜏min2\sigma_{n}^{2}(s,c)\leq(1+\epsilon_{n})\frac{2\bar{\sigma}^{2}\Gamma_{n}}{\tau% _{\text{min}}^{2}},italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ≤ ( 1 + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG 2 over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ,

where σ¯2=max(s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞⁡σ02⁢(s,c)+ρ2⁢(s,c)superscript¯𝜎2subscript𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞subscriptsuperscript𝜎20𝑠𝑐superscript𝜌2𝑠𝑐\bar{\sigma}^{2}=\max_{(s,c)\in\mathcal{S\times C}}\sigma^{2}_{0}(s,c)+\rho^{2% }(s,c)over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) + italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) and τmin=mins,c∈𝒮×𝒞⁢𝔼τ∼𝛕⁢(c)𝟏s∈τsubscript𝜏minsubscript𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞subscript𝔼similar-to𝜏𝛕𝑐subscript1𝑠𝜏\tau_{\text{min}}=\min_{s,c\in\mathcal{S\times C}}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\tau% \sim\bm{\tau}(c)}\mathbf{1}_{s\in\tau}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_c ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_τ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof.
σn2⁢(s,c)superscriptsubscript𝜎𝑛2𝑠𝑐\displaystyle\sigma_{n}^{2}(s,c)italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) =Var⁢[𝝅⁢(s,c)∣c1:n,τ1:n]absentVardelimited-[]conditional𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛\displaystyle=\mathrm{Var}[\bm{\pi}(s,c)\mid c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n}]= roman_Var [ bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (47)
=(Var⁢[𝝅⁢(s,c)∣c1:n,τ1:n]+ρ2⁢(s,c))−ρ2⁢(s,c)absentVardelimited-[]conditional𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛superscript𝜌2𝑠𝑐superscript𝜌2𝑠𝑐\displaystyle=\big{(}\mathrm{Var}[\bm{\pi}(s,c)\mid c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n}]+\rho^{% 2}(s,c)\big{)}-\rho^{2}(s,c)= ( roman_Var [ bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ) - italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) (48)
=Var⁢[𝝅~⁢(s,c)∣c1:n,τ1:n]−Var⁢[𝝅~⁢(s,c)∣𝝅⁢(s,c),c1:n,τ1:n]absentVardelimited-[]conditionalbold-~𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛Vardelimited-[]conditionalbold-~𝝅𝑠𝑐𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛\displaystyle=\mathrm{Var}[\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(s,c)\mid c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n}]-% \mathrm{Var}[\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(s,c)\mid\bm{\pi}(s,c),c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n}]= roman_Var [ overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - roman_Var [ overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (49)
≤(i)σ¯2⁢log⁡(Var⁢[𝝅~⁢(s,c)∣c1:n,τ1:n]Var⁢[𝝅~⁢(s,c)∣𝝅⁢(s,c),c1:n,τ1:n])superscript𝑖absentsuperscript¯𝜎2Vardelimited-[]conditionalbold-~𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛Vardelimited-[]conditionalbold-~𝝅𝑠𝑐𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(i)}}{{\leq}}\bar{\sigma}^{2}\log\left(% \frac{\mathrm{Var}[\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(s,c)\mid c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n}]}{\mathrm{Var}% [\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(s,c)\mid\bm{\pi}(s,c),c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n}]}\right)start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ( divide start_ARG roman_Var [ overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG start_ARG roman_Var [ overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ) (50)

≤(i⁢i)2⁢σ¯2τmin⁢𝔼τ∼𝝉⁢(c)𝟏s∈τ⁢ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s,c);𝝅~⁢(s,c)∣c1:n,τ1:n)superscript𝑖𝑖absent2superscript¯𝜎2subscript𝜏minsubscript𝔼similar-to𝜏𝝉𝑐subscript1𝑠𝜏ℐ𝝅𝑠𝑐conditionalbold-~𝝅𝑠𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(ii)}}{{\leq}}\frac{2\bar{\sigma}^{2}}{% \tau_{\text{min}}}\mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\tau\sim\bm{\tau}(c)}\mathbf{1}_{s\in% \tau}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s,c);\bm{\tilde{\pi}}(s,c)\mid c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n})start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG 2 over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_τ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (53)

≤2⁢σ¯2τmin2⁢𝔼c∼μc(s0,…)∼𝝉⁢(c)𝟏s∈(s0,…)⁢𝔼τ∼𝝉⁢(c)ℐ⁢(𝝅⁢(s,c);𝝅~⁢(τ,c)∣c1:n,τ1:n)absent2superscript¯𝜎2subscriptsuperscript𝜏2minsubscript𝔼similar-to𝑐subscript𝜇𝑐similar-tosubscript𝑠0…𝝉𝑐subscript1𝑠subscript𝑠0…subscript𝔼similar-to𝜏𝝉𝑐ℐ𝝅𝑠𝑐conditionalbold-~𝝅𝜏𝑐subscript𝑐:1𝑛subscript𝜏:1𝑛\displaystyle\leq\frac{2\bar{\sigma}^{2}}{\tau^{2}_{\text{min}}}\mathop{% \mathbb{E}}_{\begin{subarray}{c}c\sim\mu_{c}\\ (s_{0},\dots)\sim\bm{\tau}(c)\end{subarray}}\mathbf{1}_{s\in(s_{0},\dots)}% \mathop{\mathbb{E}}_{\tau\sim\bm{\tau}(c)}\mathcal{I}(\bm{\pi}(s,c);\bm{\tilde% {\pi}}(\tau,c)\mid c_{1:n},\tau_{1:n})≤ divide start_ARG 2 over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ∼ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ ∼ bold_italic_τ ( italic_c ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I ( bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ; overbold_~ start_ARG bold_italic_π end_ARG ( italic_τ , italic_c ) ∣ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (57)

=(1+ϵn)⁢2⁢σ¯2⁢Γnτmin2.absent1subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛2superscript¯𝜎2subscriptΓ𝑛superscriptsubscript𝜏min2\displaystyle=(1+\epsilon_{n})\frac{2\bar{\sigma}^{2}\Gamma_{n}}{\tau_{\text{% min}}^{2}}.= ( 1 + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG 2 over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG . (64)

where (i) follows from Lemma 8 and monotonicity of variance, (ii) holds as the state s𝑠sitalic_s is within the support of 𝝉(⋅|c)\bm{\tau}(\cdot|c)bold_italic_τ ( ⋅ | italic_c ), and (iii) follows from Lemma 1 as the difference between the expected mutual information and the mutual information for a realized trajectory is less than the difference in mutual information for two arbitrary realized trajectories. ∎

This result can then be translated to the agnostic setting, for a regular policy π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which we still model through the stochastic process 𝝅𝝅\bm{\pi}bold_italic_π. Without loss of generality we will assume that the prior variance is bounded by Var⁢[𝝅⁢(s,c)]≤1Vardelimited-[]𝝅𝑠𝑐1\mathrm{Var}[\bm{\pi}(s,c)]\leq 1roman_Var [ bold_italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ] ≤ 1.

Lemma 4.

(Well-calibrated confidence intervals, following Abbasi-Yadkori (2013)) Pick δ∈(0,1)𝛿01\delta\in(0,1)italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , 1 ). Assume that π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT lies in the RKHS ℋk⁢(𝒞)subscriptℋ𝑘𝒞\mathcal{H}_{k}(\mathcal{C})caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_C ) of the kernel k𝑘kitalic_k with norm ‖π⋆‖k<∞subscriptnormsuperscript𝜋⋆𝑘||\pi^{\star}||_{k}<\infty| | italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞, the noise ϵnsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛\epsilon_{n}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is conditionally ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-sub-Gaussian, and γnsubscript𝛾𝑛\gamma_{n}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is sublinear in n𝑛nitalic_n. Let βn⁢(δ)=‖π⋆‖k+ρ⁢2⁢(γ(H⁢n)+1+log⁡(1/δ))subscript𝛽𝑛𝛿subscriptnormsuperscript𝜋⋆𝑘𝜌2subscript𝛾𝐻𝑛11𝛿\beta_{n}(\delta)=\|\pi^{\star}\|_{k}+\rho\sqrt{2(\gamma_{(Hn)}+1+\log(1/% \delta))}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) = ∥ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ρ square-root start_ARG 2 ( italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 + roman_log ( 1 / italic_δ ) ) end_ARG. Then, for any n>1𝑛1n>1italic_n > 1 and (s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞(s,c)\in\mathcal{S\times C}( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C, G⁢P⁢(μn,k)𝐺𝑃subscript𝜇𝑛𝑘GP(\mu_{n},k)italic_G italic_P ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_k ) is an all-time well-calibrated model of π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Thus, jointly with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ,

|π⋆⁢(s,c)−μn⁢(s,c)|≤βn⁢(δ)⁢σn.superscript𝜋⋆𝑠𝑐subscript𝜇𝑛𝑠𝑐subscript𝛽𝑛𝛿subscript𝜎𝑛|\pi^{\star}(s,c)-\mu_{n}(s,c)|\leq\beta_{n}(\delta)\sigma_{n}.| italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) | ≤ italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

We note that βn⁢(δ)subscript𝛽𝑛𝛿\beta_{n}(\delta)italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) depends on γ(H⁢n)subscript𝛾𝐻𝑛\gamma_{(Hn)}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as H⁢n𝐻𝑛Hnitalic_H italic_n samples from the demonstrator’s policy are collected up to round n𝑛nitalic_n. Combining Lemmas 3 and 4 we easily get for all (s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞(s,c)\in\mathcal{S\times C}( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C and n≥0𝑛0n\geq 0italic_n ≥ 0 with probability 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ:

|π⋆⁢(s,c)−μn⁢(s,c)|≤Lemma 4βn⁢(δ)⁢σn≤Lemma 3βn⁢(δ)⁢((1+ϵn)⁢2⁢σ¯2⁢Γnτmin2)12superscriptLemma 4superscript𝜋⋆𝑠𝑐subscript𝜇𝑛𝑠𝑐subscript𝛽𝑛𝛿subscript𝜎𝑛superscriptLemma 3subscript𝛽𝑛𝛿superscript1subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛2superscript¯𝜎2subscriptΓ𝑛superscriptsubscript𝜏min212|\pi^{\star}(s,c)-\mu_{n}(s,c)|\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\text{Lemma }\ref{lemma:% well_calibrated}}}{{\leq}}\beta_{n}(\delta)\sigma_{n}\stackrel{{\scriptstyle% \text{Lemma }\ref{lemma:variance_convergence}}}{{\leq}}\beta_{n}(\delta)\Big{(% }(1+\epsilon_{n})\frac{2\bar{\sigma}^{2}\Gamma_{n}}{\tau_{\text{min}}^{2}}\Big% {)}^{\frac{1}{2}}| italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) | start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG Lemma end_ARG end_RELOP italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG Lemma end_ARG end_RELOP italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) ( ( 1 + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG 2 over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (65)

While the analysis has so far dealt with a scalar π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, a simple union bound can guarantee that

‖π⋆⁢(s,c)−μn⁢(s,c)‖1≤βn′⁢(δ)⁢‖σ¯‖1⁢((1+ϵn)⁢2⁢Γnτmin2)12subscriptnormsuperscript𝜋⋆𝑠𝑐subscript𝜇𝑛𝑠𝑐1subscriptsuperscript𝛽′𝑛𝛿subscriptnorm¯𝜎1superscript1subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛2subscriptΓ𝑛superscriptsubscript𝜏min212\|\pi^{\star}(s,c)-\mu_{n}(s,c)\|_{1}\leq\beta^{\prime}_{n}(\delta)\|\bar{% \sigma}\|_{1}\Big{(}(1+\epsilon_{n})\frac{2\Gamma_{n}}{\tau_{\text{min}}^{2}}% \Big{)}^{\frac{1}{2}}∥ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) ∥ over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( 1 + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG 2 roman_Γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (66)

with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ for an action space of dimension |𝒜|𝒜|\mathcal{A}|| caligraphic_A |, where now βn′⁢(δ)=‖π⋆‖k+ρ⁢2⁢(γ(H⁢n)+1+log⁡(|𝒜|/δ))subscriptsuperscript𝛽′𝑛𝛿subscriptnormsuperscript𝜋⋆𝑘𝜌2subscript𝛾𝐻𝑛1𝒜𝛿\beta^{\prime}_{n}(\delta)=\|\pi^{\star}\|_{k}+\rho\sqrt{2(\gamma_{(Hn)}+1+% \log(|\mathcal{A}|/\delta))}italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) = ∥ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ρ square-root start_ARG 2 ( italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 + roman_log ( | caligraphic_A | / italic_δ ) ) end_ARG. From now on, we will refer to μnsubscript𝜇𝑛\mu_{n}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as πnsubscript𝜋𝑛\pi_{n}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We are thus able to globally bound the L1subscript𝐿1L_{1}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT distance of the imitator policy with respect to the expert policy with high probability under active fine-tuning.

It is clear that, even if this distance is small, the performance of an imitator which does not exactly match the expert (πn⁢(s,c)≠π⋆⁢(s,c)subscript𝜋𝑛𝑠𝑐superscript𝜋⋆𝑠𝑐\pi_{n}(s,c)\neq\pi^{\star}(s,c)italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ≠ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) for some (s,c)∈𝒮×𝒞)(s,c)\in\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{C})( italic_s , italic_c ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C ) can be arbitrarily low for arbitrary MDPs. It is however possible to show that, as long as the Q-function of the expert is smooth, the performance gap to the expert can be controlled. We note that, in case γ⁢LP⁢(1+Lπ⋆)<1𝛾subscript𝐿𝑃1subscript𝐿superscript𝜋⋆1\gamma L_{P}(1+L_{\pi^{\star}})<1italic_γ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < 1, then the Q-function Qπ⋆superscript𝑄superscript𝜋⋆Q^{\pi^{\star}}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is guaranteed to be LQsubscript𝐿𝑄L_{Q}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz continuous with LQ≤LR1−γ⁢LP⁢(1+Lπ⋆)subscript𝐿𝑄subscript𝐿𝑅1𝛾subscript𝐿𝑃1subscript𝐿superscript𝜋⋆L_{Q}\leq\frac{L_{R}}{1-\gamma L_{P}(1+L_{\pi^{\star}})}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG (Rachelson & Lagoudakis, 2010). If smoothness holds, it is easy to connect the divergences in action space to performance gaps (Maran et al., 2023).

Lemma 5.

Let π𝜋\piitalic_π and π′superscript𝜋′\pi^{\prime}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT denote two deterministic policies. If the state-action value function Qπ′superscript𝑄superscript𝜋′Q^{\pi^{\prime}}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is LQπ′subscript𝐿superscript𝑄superscript𝜋′L_{Q^{\pi^{\prime}}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz continuous, then:

|Jπ−Jπ′|≤LQπ′1−γ⁢𝔼s∼dπ⁢[‖π′⁢(s,c)−π⁢(s,c)‖1].superscript𝐽𝜋superscript𝐽superscript𝜋′subscript𝐿superscript𝑄superscript𝜋′1𝛾subscript𝔼similar-to𝑠superscript𝑑𝜋delimited-[]subscriptnormsuperscript𝜋′𝑠𝑐𝜋𝑠𝑐1|J^{\pi}-J^{\pi^{\prime}}|\leq\frac{L_{Q^{\pi^{\prime}}}}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_% {s\sim d^{\pi}}[\|\pi^{\prime}(s,c)-\pi(s,c)\|_{1}].| italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ≤ divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∥ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_π ( italic_s , italic_c ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] .
Proof.

Given a function f:𝒜→ℝ:𝑓→𝒜ℝf:\mathcal{A}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : caligraphic_A → blackboard_R, we denote the Lipschitz semi-norm ‖f⁢(⋅)‖L=supa,a′∈𝒜|(f(a)−f(a′)|‖a−a′‖2\|f(\cdot)\|_{L}=\sup_{a,a^{\prime}\in\mathcal{A}}\frac{|(f(a)-f(a^{\prime})|}% {\|a-a^{\prime}\|_{2}}∥ italic_f ( ⋅ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG | ( italic_f ( italic_a ) - italic_f ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_a - italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. We have:

Jπ−Jπ′superscript𝐽𝜋superscript𝐽superscript𝜋′\displaystyle J^{\pi}-J^{\pi^{\prime}}italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =(i)11−γ⁢𝔼s∼dπ⁢[𝔼a∼π(⋅∣s,c)⁢[Aπ′⁢(s,c,a)]]\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(i)}}{{=}}\frac{1}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s% \sim d^{\pi}}\Bigg{[}\mathbb{E}_{a\sim\pi(\cdot\mid s,c)}[A^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c% ,a)]\Bigg{]}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a ∼ italic_π ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) ] ] (67)
=11−γ⁢𝔼s∼dπ⁢[𝔼a∼π(⋅∣s)⁢[Qπ′⁢(s,c,a)]−Vπ′⁢(s,c)]\displaystyle=\frac{1}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s\sim d^{\pi}}\Bigg{[}\mathbb{E}_{% a\sim\pi(\cdot\mid s)}[Q^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c,a)]-V^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c)\Bigg{]}= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a ∼ italic_π ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) ] - italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ] (68)
=11−γ⁢𝔼s∼dπ⁢[∫a∈𝒜π⁢(a∣s)⁢Qπ′⁢(s,c,a)−Vπ′⁢(s,c)]absent11𝛾subscript𝔼similar-to𝑠superscript𝑑𝜋delimited-[]subscript𝑎𝒜𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠superscript𝑄superscript𝜋′𝑠𝑐𝑎superscript𝑉superscript𝜋′𝑠𝑐\displaystyle=\frac{1}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s\sim d^{\pi}}\Bigg{[}\int_{a\in% \mathcal{A}}\pi(a\mid s)Q^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c,a)-V^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c)\Bigg{]}= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a ∣ italic_s ) italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) - italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c ) ] (69)
=11−γ⁢𝔼s∼dπ⁢[∫a∈𝒜Qπ′⁢(s,c,a)⁢[π⁢(a∣s,c)−π′⁢(a∣s,c)]]absent11𝛾subscript𝔼similar-to𝑠superscript𝑑𝜋delimited-[]subscript𝑎𝒜superscript𝑄superscript𝜋′𝑠𝑐𝑎delimited-[]𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝑐superscript𝜋′conditional𝑎𝑠𝑐\displaystyle=\frac{1}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s\sim d^{\pi}}\Bigg{[}\int_{a\in% \mathcal{A}}Q^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c,a)[\pi(a\mid s,c)-\pi^{\prime}(a\mid s,c)]% \Bigg{]}= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) [ italic_π ( italic_a ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) ] ] (70)
≤11−γ⁢𝔼s∼dπ⁢[∫a∈𝒜sups,c∈𝒮×𝒞Qπ⁢(s,c,a)⁢[π⁢(a∣s,c)−π′⁢(a∣s,c)]]absent11𝛾subscript𝔼similar-to𝑠superscript𝑑𝜋delimited-[]subscript𝑎𝒜subscriptsupremum𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞superscript𝑄𝜋𝑠𝑐𝑎delimited-[]𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝑐superscript𝜋′conditional𝑎𝑠𝑐\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s\sim d^{\pi}}\Bigg{[}\int_{a% \in\mathcal{A}}\sup_{s,c\in\mathcal{S\times C}}Q^{\pi}(s,c,a)[\pi(a\mid s,c)-% \pi^{\prime}(a\mid s,c)]\Bigg{]}≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_c ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , italic_a ) [ italic_π ( italic_a ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) ] ] (71)
≤(i⁢i)11−γ𝔼s∼dπ[∥sups,c∈𝒮×𝒞Qπ′(s,c,⋅)∥L𝒲(π(⋅∣s,c),π′(⋅∣s,c))]\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(ii)}}{{\leq}}\frac{1}{1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}% _{s\sim d^{\pi}}\Bigg{[}\|\sup_{s,c\in\mathcal{S\times C}}Q^{\pi^{\prime}}(s,c% ,\cdot)\|_{L}\mathcal{W}(\pi(\cdot\mid s,c),\pi^{\prime}(\cdot\mid s,c))\Bigg{]}start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∥ roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_c ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , ⋅ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_W ( italic_π ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) , italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) ) ] (72)
≤(i⁢i⁢i)LQπ′1−γ𝔼s∼dπ[𝒲(π(⋅∣s,c),π′(⋅∣s,c))]\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(iii)}}{{\leq}}\frac{L_{Q^{\pi^{\prime}}}}% {1-\gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s\sim d^{\pi}}[\mathcal{W}(\pi(\cdot\mid s,c),\pi^{% \prime}(\cdot\mid s,c))]start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≤ end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_i italic_i ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_W ( italic_π ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) , italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) ) ] (73)
=(i⁢v)LQπ′1−γ𝔼s,c∼dπ[∥π(⋅∣s,c)−π′(⋅∣s,c)∥1]\displaystyle\stackrel{{\scriptstyle(iv)}}{{=}}\frac{L_{Q^{\pi^{\prime}}}}{1-% \gamma}\mathbb{E}_{s,c\sim d^{\pi}}[\|\pi(\cdot\mid s,c)-\pi^{\prime}(\cdot% \mid s,c)\|_{1}]start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_i italic_v ) end_ARG end_RELOP divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_γ end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_c ∼ italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∥ italic_π ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) - italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ ∣ italic_s , italic_c ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (74)

where (i) follows from the performance difference lemma (Kakade & Langford, 2002), (ii) follows from the definition of L1subscript𝐿1L_{1}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Wasserstein distance, (iii) holds as LQπ≥‖sups,c∈𝒮×𝒞Qπ⁢(s,c,⋅)‖Lsubscript𝐿superscript𝑄𝜋subscriptnormsubscriptsupremum𝑠𝑐𝒮𝒞superscript𝑄𝜋𝑠𝑐⋅𝐿L_{Q^{\pi}}\geq\|\sup_{s,c\in\mathcal{S\times C}}Q^{\pi}(s,c,\cdot)\|_{L}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ ∥ roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_c ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_c , ⋅ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and (iv) follows from both policies being deterministic. The proof is completed by taking the absolute value on both sides. ∎

So far, we have shown rates of convergence for the imitator, and connected its error to performance. Our main formal result can be shown by coordinating the lemmas so far presented.

Theorem 3.

(Performance guarantees for active multi-task BC) Let Assumptions 2, 3 and 4 hold. Pick δ∈(0,1)𝛿01\delta\in(0,1)italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , 1 ). Assume that π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT lies in the RKHS ℋk⁢(𝒞)subscriptℋ𝑘𝒞\mathcal{H}_{k}(\mathcal{C})caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_C ) of the kernel k𝑘kitalic_k with norm ‖π⋆‖k<∞subscriptnormsuperscript𝜋⋆𝑘||\pi^{\star}||_{k}<\infty| | italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞, the noise ϵnsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛\epsilon_{n}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is conditionally ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ-sub-Gaussian, and γnsubscript𝛾𝑛\gamma_{n}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is sublinear in n𝑛nitalic_n. If each demonstrated task is selected according to the criterion in Equation 1, then with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ the performance difference between the expert policy π⋆superscript𝜋⋆\pi^{\star}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and the imitator policy πnsubscript𝜋𝑛\pi_{n}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT after n𝑛nitalic_n demonstrations can be upper bounded:

where ϵn=8⁢H32⁢(1+max⁡(Lπ,LP))H⁢max⁡(ϵ0,ϵπ,ϵP)subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛8superscript𝐻32superscript1subscript𝐿𝜋subscript𝐿𝑃𝐻subscriptitalic-ϵ0subscriptitalic-ϵ𝜋subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑃\epsilon_{n}=8H^{\frac{3}{2}}(1+\max(L_{\pi},L_{P}))^{H}\max(\epsilon_{0},% \epsilon_{\pi},\epsilon_{P})italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 8 italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 3 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + roman_max ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Furthermore, if γn=O⁢(log⁡n)subscript𝛾𝑛𝑂𝑛\gamma_{n}=O(\log n)italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_O ( roman_log italic_n ) (e.g., for linear kernels), then Jπ⋆−Jπ→n→∞0superscript→→𝑛superscript𝐽superscript𝜋⋆superscript𝐽𝜋0J^{\pi^{\star}}-J^{\pi}\stackrel{{\scriptstyle n\to\infty}}{{\to}}0italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG → end_ARG start_ARG italic_n → ∞ end_ARG end_RELOP 0.

Proof.
